alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 2:00PM CST until January 23 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following areas, Austin, Bolivar Peninsula, Brazoria Islands, Chambers, Coastal Brazoria, Coastal Galveston, Coastal Harris, Fort Bend, Galveston Island, Inland Brazoria, Inland Galveston, Inland Harris, Northern Liberty, Southern Liberty and Waller. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall, which at times will be heavy, is expected to result in widespread totals of 2-4 inches with amounts of up to 5 inches possible where training of showers and thunderstorms occurs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island
